title: Ibero-American Alliance for Peace
text:
The Ibero-American Alliance for Peace (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>: "Alianza Iberoamericana por la Paz") is an international <a href="non-governmental%20organization">non-governmental organization</a> working to promote <a href="peacebuilding">peacebuilding</a>, <a href="human%20rights">human rights</a> and <a href="disarmament">disarmament</a> in the <a href="Ibero-America">Ibero-America</a>n region. Co-founded in 2016 by <a href="Angelo%20Cardona">Angelo Cardona</a> and Maria Teresa Barrios in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a> during the world congress 'Disarm for a Climate of Peace' of the <a href="International%20Peace%20Bureau">International Peace Bureau</a>. Initially the coalition was the International Peace Bureau Youth Network (IPBYN) for the region of <a href="Latin%20America">Latin America</a> known under the name of Latin American Youth Network for Peace"' "
History.
In 2018, the International Peace Bureau Youth Network began to prepare a series of pre-conferences of youth for peace around the world, which would end in the world conference, 'Transform! Towards a Culture of Peace' in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>, 2019. So that the Youth Network could make their conferences in <a href="Latin%20America">Latin America</a> with a name in Spanish, Cardona and Barrios founded the Latin American Youth Network for Peace (in Spanish: Red Latinoamericana de Jóvenes por la Paz) along with the members of the IPBYN in Latin America. The network is launched in the first pre-conference of the IPBYN, on April 25, 2018 in <a href="Medell%C3%ADn">Medellin</a>, <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, during the '2nd International Congress of Science and Education for development and peace' at the <a href="University%20of%20Antioquia">University of Antioquia</a>. Then, the Latin American Youth Network for Peace, carried out the second pre-conference, on July 3, 2018, in the <a href="Argentine%20Senate">Senate of the Argentine Nation</a>, during the international conference 'Let's Talk about Peace'. The Latin American Network held its third pre-conference, on October 9, 2018, this time at the <a href="Monterrey%20Institute%20of%20Technology%20and%20Higher%20Education">Tecnologico de Monterrey</a> campus in <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a>. In 2020, the members of the IPBYN in Latin America decided to change their name to <a href="Ibero-America">Ibero-America</a>n Alliance for Peace.
Ibero-American Forum for Peace.
The Ibero-American Forum for Peace is a summit of the <a href="Spanish%20language">spanish</a> and <a href="Portuguese%20language">portughese</a> speaking nations of <a href="Europe">Europe</a> and the <a href="Americas">Américas</a> organised by the Ibero-American Alliance for Peace. The gathering brings academics, civil society organizations, activists, human rights organizations, and governmental and non-governmental organisations around the theme of peace in the <a href="Ibero-America">ibero-american</a> region. The Forum bills itself as "a space for debate for citizens to have a meaningful and transformative discussion on peace, human rights, disarmament and related issues."
The summit held in 2021 in <a href="Castell%C3%B3n%20de%20la%20Plana">Castellón</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>, was attended by people of <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>, <a href="Spain">España</a>, <a href="Bolivia">Bolivia</a>, <a href="Chile">Chile</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>, <a href="Peru">Perú</a>, <a href="Nicaragua">Nicaragua</a>, <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>, <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>, <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>, <a href="Cuba">Cuba</a>, <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican Republic</a>, <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, <a href="Honduras">Honduras</a> and other countries like <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="Haiti">Haití</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, <a href="Lebanon">Lebanon</a> and <a href="Romania">Romania</a>. It was organised in cooperation with the Center for research, defense and promotion of the rights of children and adolescents (ILÊWASI, for its name in <a href="Catalan%20language">Catalan</a>) and the <a href="Jaume%20I%20University">Jaume I University</a> of Castellón. 
Summits.
Since its formation in 2018, the Alliance has carried out different summits in the <a href="Ibero-America">Ibero-American</a> region.
